commit_message:
Configure server_certs_key_passphrase for Octavia

A recent change[1] to Octavia added a parameter named
server_certs_key_passphrase, which means that TripleO should
generate a password for it to avoid using the default value.

This patch adds OctaviaServerCertsKeyPassphrase to the list
of parameters TripleO configures in Octavia.

Conflicts:
      ci/environments/scenario010-standalone.yaml
      deployment/octavia/octavia-base.yaml
      environments/services/octavia.yaml

Note that octavia-base.yaml exists under puppet/services since
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/638762 got merged in
stable/stein.

Closes-Bug: #1821756
Related-Bug: #1821751

commit_message:
Fix NovaNfs role parameters

This I2702a022565a130ab339d165cb2252ad67d1162e introduces bug
which breaks NFS for Nova. The NFS task in in host_prep_tasks
did not run because we did not meet the nfs_backend_enable|bool
condition.

Closes-Bug: #1832850

Change-Id: Id918080bf0817ce24eb4abe716a4f1b1375c236d
(cherry picked from commit 60248889a59957c1b323ce6a9859d56eb78cfce3)
(cherry picked from commit 247e8e86f31b48f85e849d242f3a31f99ccc7665)
(cherry picked from commit fbd3638e2d97b889de9ae022d76c65360d9d8bd9)

commit_message:
Add pkg names better management between OS releases

The check-latest-minor-version role checks if the latest minor version
of python-tripleoclient rpm is installed on the Undercloud. But now, the
package is called python2-tripleoclient on RHEL/CentOS 7 and
python3-tripleoclient on RHEL 8 and it should be the same on the future
CentOS 8.

This patch fixes the naming issue across the supported OS.

Change-Id: If4aeeca507abc1aee3e783a25fb325e53152753e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 306f531c1c67c9540f36040ff71905dd228d1497)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/40/665540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tripleoclient: >- {%- if ansible_distribution == 'RedHat' and ansible_distribution_major_version == '8' -%} python3-tripleoclient {%- else -%} python2-tripleoclient {%- endif -%} packages: - "{{ tripleoclient }}"

commit_message:
Skip running tripleo on lower-constraint changes

We don't need to run any tripleo jobs on the lower-constraints changes,
so let's skip that one.

Change-Id: I9d9034ed957a12ff2d5e65e4d62e37b05d1d028a

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: Ie8646a08c430a1d660a00595545c6de8221319d3

Include requirements.txt in testenv deps

Projects generally need both requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt
for running their unit tests.

commit_message:
Remove nova-consoleauth

The nova-consoleauth service was deprecated during the Rocky release [1]
and has not been necessary since unless you're using cells v1. As Kolla
has never supported cells v1, which is finally being removed during
Train [2], we can get ahead of the curve and stop deploying
nova-consoleauth immediately.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/implemented/convert-consoles-to-objects.html
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/remove-cells-v1/

Change-Id: I099080979f5497537e390f531005a517ab12aa7a

commit_message:
Add Placement service to Minimal deployment for Stein

Placement service installation is removed in nova installation since Stein.
This patch adds Placement service to Minimal deployment for Stein.

Change-Id: Ia91d2abe303ce18f9eb392ca4db2be64df79e1d6
Closes-Bug: #1831822

commit_message:
Uniquify allocation mappings

When creating the allocation mappings output, use a set() not a
list() so that any single resource provider only shows up once.
The initial implementation (at
Ie78ed7e050416d4ccb62697ba608131038bb4303) allowed a provider to
show up multiple times if it contributed more than one class
of inventory.

This slipped through because of a missing test. A test that covers
the issue is added.k

Change-Id: If00f01534b7d0ec84ca8abaeef5b90a16cbcffc3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/38/665638/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ensure controllers all call super

Currently some do and some don't. Do it by default as intended. We also
remove the 'view_builder' argument from the base 'Controller.__init__'
function since nothing was actually setting this.

Change-Id: Ic0b16608078e4545f546509df94caba3166ed6e2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[neutron] Do not migrate all subprojects

Instead of migrating all Neutron subprojects at bootstrap time, target
specifically the neutron, neutron-fwaas, and neutron-vpnaas subprojects
speficially. If a subproject is not specified, all subprojects are
migrated, which is not the intended behavior.

Change-Id: Icb8d572b7f084804e0423a8a3171dd66646b3885
(cherry picked from commit f36d7aacf28bc75a4b0ece73b45aa09591cd262c)

commit_message:
Revert "docker/compose: quote health-cmd"

This reverts commit 9fbbad559dcffaf4d57c5c1c244db3b80e09106c.
This patch was wrong. We don't need the quotes because
we use subprocess and the args aren't parsed lie on
bash.

Change-Id: I47a6dd2f57809c02d57b0772e6c17150cb6687b3
Related-Bug: #1824808

commit_message:
OVS Revalidator and handler threads config

OVS revalidator hanlder threads are not contained to limited cores.
This patch will enable them to be configured in puppet vswitch module

(cherry picked from commit 6bc5b206e72409baf6dc9883d0e4789a7155bbb0)

commit_message:
systemd should recover Keepalived

Currently, haproxy gets recovered by systemd, but keepalived does not.
We know Octavia can recover from such scenario by swapping the failed
Amphora, yet in a case where systemd can assist here, it will recover
much faster.

This patch modifies the keepalived systemd unit file as follows:

KillMode=mixed (was: process)
Restart=always

Story: 2003308
Task: 24263

Change-Id: I0e5a358c5f7b631646d8cca2ff5b86181ad19169
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/93/588993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow mitral-executor to perform undercloud backups

This patch adds possibility to :
  - execute mysqldump by installing the mariadb/mysql-client
  - execute sudo in mistral_executor on chown and tar explicitly
    just for the backup purposes by adding sudoers file

Partial-Bug: #1812960
Change-Id: I67899db3c1f4197210bc362a8f944529a3a7b2b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/08/640008/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove faulty placement::config leftovers

Remove the leftover auth parameters in placement::config.

These are from the puppet-nova extraction and should not be
set in the placement section in placement's configuration file
since there is none.

This patch makes sure they are removed from the configuration
file to make sure deployments doesn't have auth config's laying
around that should not be there.

Change-Id: Ifacef570b2296b1b62c75d850c6059562ec4cb1c

commit_message:
Improve performance on get and create/update/delete requests

This change follows up on the previous performance improvements
and does the same for crud requests.
I9d67f0966561baaefb50ae97b943ff6593e194eb
I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e

We remove from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from the get_loabalancer, get_pool, get_listener,
get_healthmonitor, get_l7policy, get_l7policy_rule,
get_pool_member.

Instead it more directly transforms from the SQLAlchemy model to the
required api dictionary format. Thus this entirely skips loading a few
relations that walking the intermediary object model triggered without
the target output needing them.

This is in particular important on calls like _get_driver_for_loadbalancer
as it previously would load the loadbalancer and all related objects
just to get the provider name for the loadbalancer.

Story: 2004949
Task: 29365

Change-Id: Ic268ea3cdcf809f62ba1ab3ebf8ab6d22f871404
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/76/635076/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_loadbalancer_as_api_dict(self, context, id): lb_db = self._get_resource(context, models.LoadBalancer, id) return lb_db.to_api_dict def get_listener_as_api_dict(self, context, id): listener_db = self._get_resource(context, models.Listener, id) return listener_db.to_api_dict def get_pool_as_api_dict(self, context, id): pool_db = self._get_resource(context, models.PoolV2, id) return pool_db.to_api_dict def get_pool_member_as_api_dict(self, context, id): member_db = self._get_resource(context, models.MemberV2, id) return member_db.to_api_dict

commit_message:
Revert "docker/compose: quote health-cmd"

This reverts commit 9fbbad559dcffaf4d57c5c1c244db3b80e09106c.
This patch was wrong. We don't need the quotes because
we use subprocess and the args aren't parsed lie on
bash.

Change-Id: I066fb243caa7f9fd819a7f91c47857b3aa678807
Related-Bug: #1824808

commit_message:
Allow specifying destination for cold migrations

This was added in microversion 2.56 but was not previously exposed in
OSC. Close this gap.

Change-Id: I22d37059231a009c91150ad2f494f21ea188f9cf
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/74/649574/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kwargs = {} if parsed_args.live: kwargs['block_migration'] = parsed_args.block_migration if parsed_args.block_migration or parsed_args.disk_overcommit: if compute_client.api_version < api_versions.APIVersion('2.56'): if parsed_args.host: msg = _('--os-compute-api-version 2.56 or later is ' 'required') raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) if parsed_args.host: kwargs['host'] = parsed_args.host server.migrate(**kwargs)
deleted_lines: if parsed_args.live: kwargs = { 'block_migration': parsed_args.block_migration } if (parsed_args.block_migration or parsed_args.disk_overcommit or parsed_args.host): server.migrate()

commit_message:
Enhance Storage models to support RAID config

The Storage, Volume, and Drive resource models are enhanced to enable
the implementation of RAID configuration management.

Change-Id: Ia1ba7f08c6574c7497ca7464a52f46a5b72bc0cd
Story: 2003514
Task: 30593

commit_message:
Fix bare reference of cinder_enable_iscsi_backend

Ansible is throwing a deprecation warning for this so we need to add a
|bool to the usage of cinder_enable_iscsi_backend

Change-Id: If536dbc8ace915d171a23e289da2777e74dc3b27
Related-Bug: #1832402

subject: Update amphora-agent to report UDP listener health
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-30 14:44:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/2f2d4b91e25f7a907985b3bfbc62abd78ef95531', 'message': 'Update amphora-agent to report UDP listener health

Currently the amphora-agent is not reporting UDP listener health
when the UDP listener does not have a pool and members.
This patch changes that behavior to report the listener as healthy
if the keepalived process is started and running in the amphora.

Change-Id: Ifc28b4991852e59c0d27b4ab3d1afc4e9965e88b
Story: 2003592
Task: 24911
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-08-30 14:51:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/8fba643cf5f7d4ef00dd9b2288a41bacf89ade82', 'message': 'Update amphora-agent to report UDP listener health

Currently the amphora-agent is not reporting UDP listener health
when the UDP listener does not have a pool and members.
This patch changes that behavior to report the listener as healthy
if the keepalived process is started and running in the amphora.

commit_message:
Update amphora-agent to report UDP listener health

Currently the amphora-agent is not reporting UDP listener health
when the UDP listener does not have a pool and members.
This patch changes that behavior to report the listener as healthy
if the keepalived process is started and running in the amphora.

This patch also introduces message versioning for the health
heartbeat messages.

It also corrects a few assertEqual tests that had the reference and
actual values backwards.

Change-Id: Ifc28b4991852e59c0d27b4ab3d1afc4e9965e88b
Story: 2003592
Task: 24911

If this listener has a pool and members, # the stats will be updated later in the code flow. listener_stats_res.update({ check_listener_id: { 'stats': { 'bout': 0, 'bin': 0, 'scur': 0, 'stot': 0, 'ereq': 0}, 'status': constants.OPEN}}) return listener_stats_res

commit_message:
Disable iscsi.service to avoid iscsid on host from getting started

When some stale shutdown happens on the node, iscsi.service detects
remaining information about iscsi connection, and recovers connections
based on the information, with starting iscsid service on host.
This causes a collision between iscsid on host and iscsid in container,
which makes iscsid container keep restarting.

This patch makes sure that iscsi.service on host is disabled
when we deploy iscsid container, to avoid iscsid on host is started
unexpectedly.

Change-Id: I6c36cd15edfa53c3c76be9095ff40cecf451490d
Closes-Bug: #1833019
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/64/665564/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check if iscsi.service is snabled command: systemctl is-enabled --quiet iscsi.service ignore_errors: True register: iscsi_service_enabled_result - name: Stop iscsi.service service: name=iscsi.service state=stopped enabled=no when: - iscsi_service_enabled_result|bool

commit_message:
db_setup: refactor database setup to a common file

This patch refactors the database creation to db_setup.yml which
will eventually be managed by openstack-ansible-tests.

This also re-orders the mq_setup to be done earlier so these system
level dependencies are ready before service activation.

Change-Id: If399f3a515b0f3306819c23f1f62bc1b6ee0ea32

commit_message:
Fixed renaming topic breaking service

Changing the topic currently changes the service_name. This
breaks the service, as the service_name is also used to
load the appropriate configuration seection for the service.

> self._service_config = CONF['service:%s' % self.service_name]

* Renames cfg option [service:<name>].<name>_topic to [service:<name>].topic
* Removed previously unused configs related to topics.
* Added topic override for producer.
* Added test coverage.

Closes-Bug: #1832799
Change-Id: I16385361ec25025aa533df80793dfc4d22151cbb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/68/665268/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.topic = topic if topic else cfg.CONF['service:worker'].topic target = messaging.Target(topic=self.topic, version=self.RPC_API_VERSION)
deleted_lines: topic = topic if topic else cfg.CONF['service:worker'].worker_topic target = messaging.Target(topic=topic, version=self.RPC_API_VERSION)

subject: Rename `drivers` to `resources/systems`
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-21 19:25:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy-tools/commit/cd4baee04c293bd3f4fa4f094ddf9044ab09ebeb', 'message': 'Rename `drivers` to `systems`

This change internally renames the backend `drivers` abstraction to
`systems` because those drivers actually back Redfish "Systems"
resources.

This change is a pre-requisite for the upcoming Redfish "Managers"
resource support.

No user-visible changes should be caused by this modification.

Change-Id: I811aa18b7c55b1f9b573f7fcc479edf3619742e3

This change internally renames the backend `drivers` abstraction to
`systems` because those drivers actually back Redfish "Systems"
resources.

This change is proposed in anticipation of the upcoming driver-based
Redfish "Managers" resource support.

commit_message:
Rename `drivers` to `resources/systems`

This change internally renames backend `drivers` abstraction to
`resources/systems` drivers to set the stage for clear separation
of independently emulated resources.

This change is proposed in preparation of the upcoming Redfish
"Managers", "Chassis", "VirtualMedia" and "IndicatorLED"
resources implementation.

No user-visible changes should be caused by this modification.

Change-Id: I811aa18b7c55b1f9b573f7fcc479edf3619742e3

commit_message:
Fix auto setup Barbican's ACL in the legacy driver.

Add calls barbican legacy driver for set_acl and unset_acl actions when
using certificates in a container.

Change-Id: I7984c85ec98b6b8df00db1b2c58ddc067508b1a5
Story: 2003905

commit_message:
Add automatic documentation for new roles

When new roles are created following the contributing process,
documentation will now be automatically generated using the
role itself as content.

The automatic documentation process has been added to the
role-addition.yml playbook making it easy for developers to
get started.

Change-Id: Idba128e441a1a4fdff30ff1b9105f7ca8d199345
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add releasentoes and documentation jobs

This change adds documentation and releaseonte jobs which will
validate docs written and publish them as needed.

Change-Id: Ic517ec411fe031101f2fac96a5c5f831f203ac40
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup ConfFixture

This makes the ConfFixture extend the Config fixture from
oslo.config which handles cleanup for us. The module level
import_opt calls are also removed since they are no longer
needed.

Change-Id: I869e89c53284c8da45e0b1293f2d35011f5bfbf9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/50/664750/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import fixturesCONF = cfg.CONF CONF.import_opt('host', 'watcher.conf.service') CONF.import_opt('connection', 'oslo_db.options', group='database') CONF.import_opt('sqlite_synchronous', 'oslo_db.options', group='database') class ConfFixture(fixtures.Fixture): def __init__(self, conf=cfg.CONF): self.conf = conf self.addCleanup(self.conf.reset)

commit_message:
Remove ipxe tags when ipx6 is in use.

Turns out the dhcp server doesn't always do the right thing
and our duplicated tags seem to create confusion. So lets
remove them so ipxe6 will work.

Change-Id: I446cb814ae41cfd1e9a4ed45f27dac17e9b5bb61
Story: 2005885
Task: 33734

commit_message:
Increase timeout of temp swift URLs from 1 to 4 hours

It can take longer than 1 hour for a temporary swift
URL which stores the backup of the fetch directory to
be created vs used. Increase the timeout from 1 hour
to 4 hours so that the URL does not expire before it
is used.

Change-Id: Ib989bd673c694a9dc5af2a4a63ed84888f102a50
Fixes-Bug: #1832509

commit_message:
Document dev_mode for container image prepare

- Update the container image prepare document for dev mode install:
  https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-tripleo-modify-image#dev-install

- Update standalone manual to refer to the container image prepare page
  for special needs during a standalone deployment.

Change-Id: I666dc2b00ebbe56d957526a2a0b1966ddfcdfcf7

added_lines: Modify with Python source code installed via pip from OpenDev Gerrit .................................................................... If you would like to build an image and apply your patch in a Python project in OpenStack, you can use this example: ContainerImagePrepare: - push_destination: true ... includes: - heat-api modify_role: tripleo-modify-image modify_append_tag: "-devel" modify_vars: tasks_from: dev_install.yml source_image: docker.io/tripleomaster/centos-binary-heat-api:current-tripleo refspecs: - project: heat refspec: refs/changes/12/1234/3 ... It will produce a modified image with Python source code installed via pip.

commit_message:
Fix non-interactive mode for apt

Since sudo was laucnhed after setting DEBIAN_FRONTEND variable,
noninteractive wasn't working correctly during bindep installation.

Also patch includes temporary fix which is generally adressed in [1]
This is implemented to resolve cross-dependency and will be rolled
back once general fix will land.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/665244/

Change-Id: I44c6aa7a0266285ca67edca70cdc4450c64671d9
(cherry picked from commit 1084ff6d5acab882de1a361fc4144ec0630f520d)

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2019-06-14 18:01:33.000000000', 'files': ['doc/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/get-serial-console-post-resp.json', 'doc/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/v2.6/create-vnc-console-resp.json', 'doc/source/admin/remote-console-access.rst', 'nova/objects/console_auth_token.py', 'doc/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/get-spice-console-post-resp.json', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_console_auth_tokens.py', 'doc/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/get-rdp-console-post-resp.json', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/get-vnc-console-post-resp.json.tpl', 'doc/source/admin/figures/SCH_5009_V00_NUAC-VNC_OpenStack.svg', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_console_auth_token.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/get-serial-console-post-resp.json.tpl', 'releasenotes/notes/support-novnc-1.1.0-ce677fe3381b2a11.yaml', 'doc/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/get-vnc-console-post-resp.json', 'nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/rest_api_version_history.rst', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/get-rdp-console-post-resp.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-remote-consoles/get-spice-console-post-resp.json.tpl'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9606c80402f6db20d62b689c58aa8f024183628a', 'message': "Add 'path' query parameter to console access url

Starting in noVNC v1.1.0, the token query parameter is no longer
forwarded via cookie [1]. We must instead use the 'path' query
parameter to pass the token through to the websocketproxy [2].
This means that if someone deploys noVNC v1.1.0, VNC consoles will
break in nova because the code is relying on the cookie functionality
that v1.1.0 removed.

This modifies the ConsoleAuthToken.access_url property to include the
'path' query parameter as part of the returned access_url that the
client will use to call the console proxy service.

This change is backward compatible with noVNC < v1.1.0. The 'path' query
parameter is a long supported feature in noVNC.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1822676

[1] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/commit/51f9f0098d306bbc67cc8e02ae547921b6f6585c
[2] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/pull/1220

Change-Id: I2ddf0f4d768b698e980594dd67206464a9cea37b
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'path' query parameter to console access url

Starting in noVNC v1.1.0, the token query parameter is no longer
forwarded via cookie [1]. We must instead use the 'path' query
parameter to pass the token through to the websocketproxy [2].
This means that if someone deploys noVNC v1.1.0, VNC consoles will
break in nova because the code is relying on the cookie functionality
that v1.1.0 removed.

This modifies the ConsoleAuthToken.access_url property to include the
'path' query parameter as part of the returned access_url that the
client will use to call the console proxy service.

This change is backward compatible with noVNC < v1.1.0. The 'path' query
parameter is a long supported feature in noVNC.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1822676

[1] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/commit/51f9f0098d306bbc67cc8e02ae547921b6f6585c
[2] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/pull/1220

Change-Id: I2ddf0f4d768b698e980594dd67206464a9cea37b

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Remove remanents of 'build_sphinx' usage

We no longer build docs with setuptools (or pbr) but rather by calling
'sphinx-build' directly. However, we have stuff left over from the days
before this switch. Remove them.

Change-Id: I185005c61c3269f9b1e96d28376ae67b7f7a7463
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/62/665162/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: [build_sphinx] all_files = 1 build-dir = doc/build source-dir = doc/source warning-is-error = 1 [pbr] warnerrors = True

commit_message:
Fix TCP listener logging bug

HAProxy is not handling two of the HTTP log format variables correct
when the load balancer has a TCP listener.
This patch corrects that problem.

Change-Id: I2eb8a0b5de46ee56321bc0009b6ca2b3ad4caebf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/70/665470/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _format_log_string(self, load_balancer, protocol): # Order of these filters matter. # TODO(johnsom) Remove when HAProxy handles the format string # with HTTP variables in TCP listeners. # Currently it either throws an error or just fails # to log the message. if protocol not in constants.HAPROXY_HTTP_PROTOCOLS: log_format = log_format.replace('%{+Q}r', '-') log_format = log_format.replace('%r', '-') log_format = log_format.replace('%{+Q}ST', '-') log_format = log_format.replace('%ST', '-') 'user_log_format': self._format_log_string(loadbalancer, listener.protocol),

commit_message:
Increase request timeout for sidecar

By default sidecar timeout to authenticate to Keystone
is set to 5 seconds.

In most of the cases 5 seconds is enough but depending
the environment, the authentication complexity, etc...
it could be too short.

Change-Id: I02146bc67ec783786aa280f7759623abeb84bd21
Story: 2005769
Task: 33486

commit_message:
NUMACell, InstanceNUMACell: Adopt 'PCPU' changes

This patch makes 'NUMACell' and 'InstanceNUMACell' object ready
to accept 'PCPU'.

NOTE:
These changes are unused until the code which stores PCPU into
NUMACell and InstanceNUMACell is merged.

Partially Implements: blueprint cpu-resources
Change-Id: If7407709104497d686bde8466ca6d56be9147e6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/21/576021/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
PCPU: Define numa dedicated CPU resource class

This patch adds PCPU resource class representing an amount of
dedicated CPUs for a single guest.

There will be a series of patches to simplify the quantitative
tracking of dedicated CPU resources consistent with the tracking
of shared CPU resources via the placement API.

Partially Implements: blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I0e5346547c0490265fdc2edc33d84567bcef7cb2

subject: Implement allocation candidate mappings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-05-30 15:35:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/commit/75256969da5d28e04ba3501b076ae23380048078', 'message': "WIP: Implement allocation candidate mappings

In microversion 1.34 add a 'mappings' key to each allocation
request. It's value is dict keyed by resource group suffixes
with values of a list of resource providers satisfying that
group.

Posted early to get some feedback on if it is the right thing.

It is a WIP because:

* The spec has not merged.
* No api-ref, rest history or reno updates
* The tests are too limited and need a variety of things, in
  particular exercising nested (rather than shared) granular queries.
  It's as yet unconfirmed if the right suffix will be carried through
  the candidate expansion and collapse that happens.
* Incoming allocation schema are not updated to accept (but ignore) the
  mappings key.

Note that I hadn't intended to do this, I was simply doing some
exploratory warmup exercises to prep for the various nested magic
things, and this just sort of fell out. Tetsuro's RequestSearchContext
helped greatly. I suspect that the suffix could have been available
in other ways, but putting it on the context placed it where we want
it.

Change-Id: Ie78ed7e050416d4ccb62697ba608131038bb4303
Story: 2005575
Task: 33536

commit_message:
Implement allocation candidate mappings

In microversion 1.34 add a 'mappings' key to each allocation
request. Its value is dict keyed by resource group suffixes
with values of a list of resource providers satisfying that
group.

To preserve symmetry, the mappings key may be sent back when
writing allocations so the schema for POST and PUT allocations
and POST /reshaper are updated.

api history, api-ref and reno are added

Change-Id: Ie78ed7e050416d4ccb62697ba608131038bb4303
Story: 2005575
Task: 33536

from old path was enabled.

commit_message:
Ensure that get_host_ip() is mocked out in test

The test test_setup_ufw() didn't mock out get_host_ip() which meant that
the test leaked and used an actual IP hostname lookup.  This failed when
ubuntu.com's IP address changed.  This patch mocks it out properly.

Change-Id: Ida7aaa7d085cc0316aa496d0a0e24333c5828cee
Closes-Bug: #1832829
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-swift-storage refs/changes/01/665401/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @patch.object(swift_utils, 'get_host_ip') def test_setup_ufw(self, mock_grant_access, mock_rsync, mock_get_host_ip): def _get_host_ip(ip): if ip == 'ubuntu.com': return '91.189.94.40' else: return ip mock_get_host_ip.side_effect = _get_host_ip swift_utils.setup_ufw()

Updated context to use project_id

Fixed a bunch of deprecated warnings from oslo.context.

* Use project_id instead of tenant.
* Use user_id, domain_id etc.

Change-Id: I6e8affbabeca4162f11fb4ba47ffa2e960103ccd

subject: Update tripleo-validations before upgrading the undercloud.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-14 09:07:59.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/common/undercloud_prerequisites.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/9ac1e58fe6ddf1c06f9784b0d18a8baadb238e93', 'message': "Update tripleo-validations before upgrading the undercloud.

From rocky to stein, the tripleo-validations project has experienced
a big refactoring having some directories and files moved. When
upgrading the undercloud, the openstack-tripleo-validations is not
included as a dependency in the tripleo-heat-templates, tripleo-common
or tripleoclient spec file and as a consequence, the package won't get
updated.

The result is that the undercloud upgrade operation fails because it
can't locate the tripleo-validations files in the right location:
No such playbook: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-validations/playbooks/
undercloud-disk-space-pre-upgrade.yaml

This patch ensures that openstack-tripleo-validations package is also
upgraded before upgrading the undercloud.

Change-Id: Ibfaa563a5882af0bff33b0e0cba92cb1b6a282fb
Closes-Bug: #1831041
"}]
commit_message:
Update tripleo-validations before upgrading the undercloud.

From rocky to stein, the tripleo-validations project has experienced
a big refactoring having some directories and files moved. When
upgrading the undercloud, the openstack-tripleo-validations is not
included as a dependency in the tripleo-heat-templates, tripleo-common
or tripleoclient spec file and as a consequence, the package won't get
updated.

The result is that the undercloud upgrade operation fails because it
can't locate the tripleo-validations files in the right location:
No such playbook: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-validations/playbooks/
undercloud-disk-space-pre-upgrade.yaml

This patch ensures that openstack-tripleo-validations package is also
upgraded before upgrading the undercloud.

Change-Id: Ibfaa563a5882af0bff33b0e0cba92cb1b6a282fb
Closes-Bug: #1831041

commit_message:
Custom initial number of replicas

Added support to specify the initial number of replica sets during
runtime creation. If not specified, the number of replicas in conf file
is taken as default.

Change-Id: Ied839e7ab640b7e1678b781cd939ba3f3885f64f
Task: 23187
Story: 2003095

commit_message:
Standardize CPU resource tracking

We would like to both simplify the configuration of a compute node with
regards to CPU resource inventory as well as make the quantitative
tracking of dedicated CPU resources consistent with the tracking of
shared CPU resources via the placement API.

Change-Id: I9200c2b18369da8b9194a8ccbbf6f1baf6a9613c
blueprint: cpu-resources
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/81/555081/26 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================== CPU resource tracking ===================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/cpu-resources We would like to both simplify the configuration of a compute node with regards to CPU resource inventory as well as make the quantitative tracking of dedicated CPU resources consistent with the tracking of shared CPU resources via the placement API. Problem description =================== The ways that CPU resources are currently tracked in Nova is overly complex and, due to the coupling of CPU pinning with NUMA-related concepts inside the InstanceNUMATopology and NUMATopology (host) objects, difficult to reason about in terms that are consistent with other classes of resource in nova. Tracking of dedicated CPU resources is not done using the placement API, therefore there is no wasy way to view the physical processor usage in the system. The CONF options surrounding host CPU inventory are difficult to understand, and despite efforts to document them, there remain only a few individuals that even know how to "properly" configure a compute node for hosting certain workloads. We would like to both simplify the configuration of a compute node with regards to CPU resource inventory as well as make the quantitative tracking of dedicated CPU resources consistent with the tracking of shared CPU resources via the placement API. Definitions ----------- **physical processor** A single logical processor on the host machine that is associated with a physical CPU core or hyperthread **dedicated CPU** A physical processor that has been marked to be used for a single guest only **shared CPU** A physical processor that has been marked to be used for multiple guests **guest CPU** A logical processor configured in a guest **VCPU** Resource class representing a unit of CPU resources for a single guest approximating the processing power of a single physical processor **PCPU** Resource class representing an amount of dedicated CPUs for a single guest **CPU pinning** The process of deciding which guest CPU should be assigned to which dedicated CPU **pinset** A set of physical processors **pinset string** A specially-encoded string that indicates a set of specific physical processors Use Cases --------- As an NFV orchestration system, I want to be able to differentiate between CPU resources that require stable performance and CPU resources that can tolerate inconsistent performance As an edge cloud deployer, I want to specify which physical processors should be used for dedicated CPU and which should be used for shared CPU Proposed change =============== CPU inventory configuration --------------------------- We propose to model both shared and dedicated CPU resources in the placement service as inventory records. While the placement service would not be responsible for the process of CPU pinning (i.e. the assignment of a dedicated CPU to a guest CPU), the placement service would become responsible for storing the amounts of ``VCPU`` and ``PCPU`` resources that the compute node resource provider and any NUMA node child providers might expose. The virt driver will be responsible for reporting the amount of VCPU and PCPU resources for a host system. It shall do this by examining the contents of two new CONF options (these are new CONF options so that we do not break backwards compatibility):: [compute] cpu_dedicated_set cpu_shared_set The above new CONF options will store a pinset string that indicates the physical processors that should be used for the ``PCPU`` and ``VCPU`` resource requests, respectively. The two pinsets produced by the above new CONF options should be **disjoint sets**. **Note**: the entire set of physical processors that the host system contains can be greater than the union of ``CONF.cpu_dedicated_set`` and ``CONF.cpu_shared_set``. The set difference between the entire set of physical processors on a host system and the union of the dedicated and shared pinsets shall represent the number of physical processors that has been reserved for the host **Note**: the existing ``CONF.vcpu_pin_set`` will be **deprecated** in the "S" release for removal in the "T" release. The CONF.cpu_dedicated_set and CONF.cpu_shared_set make CONF.vcpu_pin_set irrelevant. As an example, consider a host system with 2 sockets, each with 24 physical cores and 2 hyperthreads per physical core. Physical processors 0-47 are on one socket. Physical processors 48-95 are on the other. The operator wishes to reserve the first physical core and its hyperthreads on each socket for the host's use. Furthermore, the operator wants to use 8 of each socket's physical cores (16 physical processors per socket) for dedicated CPU resources and the remaining physical processors will be for shared CPU resources. For the shared CPU resources, the operator wants to allow an oversubscription of 8 guest CPUs to each physical processor. The operator would set the CONF options like so:: [compute] cpu_dedicated_set=2-18,50-66 cpu_shared_set=19-47,67-96 If there was no need to track NUMA affinity, the virt driver would report this to the placement service as a set of inventory records on a single compute node resource provider like so:: PCPU: total: 32 reserved: 4 min_unit: 1 max_unit: 32 step_size: 1 allocation_ratio: 1.0 VCPU: total: 60 reserved: 0 min_unit: 1 max_unit: 60 step_size: 1 allocation_ratio: 8.0 If there was a need to track NUMA affinity, the virt driver would instead construct a provider tree containing two NUMA node child providers of the parent compute node resource provider and report inventory for each NUMA node separately:: NUMA NODE 0: PCPU: total: 16 reserved: 2 min_unit: 1 max_unit: 16 step_size: 1 allocation_ratio: 1.0 VCPU: total: 30 reserved: 0 min_unit: 1 max_unit: 30 step_size: 1 allocation_ratio: 8.0 NUMA NODE 1: PCPU: total: 16 reserved: 2 min_unit: 1 max_unit: 16 step_size: 1 allocation_ratio: 1.0 VCPU: total: 30 reserved: 0 min_unit: 1 max_unit: 30 step_size: 1 allocation_ratio: 8.0 Guest resource requests ----------------------- We propose to utilize the existing flavor ``resource:$RESOURCE_CLASS=$AMOUNT`` extra-specs system for requesting both shared and dedicated CPU resources for a guest. Note that a single guest may request both shared and dedicated CPU resources. The guest uses a non-granular request group that requests a number of dedicated CPUs and a number of shared CPUs. * The number of shared CPUs needed by the guest shall be stored in the existing ``resource:VCPU=$AMOUNT`` extra spec key. * The number of dedicated CPUs needed by the guest shall be stored in the ``resource:PCPU=$AMOUNT`` This will allow the placement service to filter out compute nodes that do not at least have the required number of shared or dedicated CPU resources that the guest requires. The providers of these resources may be a compute node or a NUMA node, depending on whether the host system is a NUMA system. **Note**: the existing ``hw:cpu_allocation_policy=dedicated|shared`` flavor extra spec and image property will be **deprecated** in the "S" release for removal in the "T" release. This extra spec will be irrelevant when flavors can indicate the exact number of dedicated and shared CPU resources they require. Guest tolerance for hyperthreads -------------------------------- Certain guests have a tolerance for physical processors being a hyperthread sibling. The ``hw:cpu_threads_policy`` existing flavor and image extra spec currently controls the behaviour of the code that does CPU pinning for a guest. This pinning code is executed in the NUMATopologyFilter scheduler filter as part of the call to ``nova.virt.hardware.numa_fit_instance_to_host()``. We propose to leave this code unchanged. The NUMATopologyFilter shall remain in place and will continue to function as-is. The work from this spec, however, means that fewer HostInfo structs will be passed to the NUMATopologyFilter than before, since the placement service will be able to efficiently filter out compute nodes that do not meet the basic quantitative resource requirements indicated by the PCPU and VCPU resource classes. Dedicated emulator threads -------------------------- The existing ``hw:emulator_threads_policy=isolate|share`` flavor extra spec and image property currently indicate to the virt driver whether to "reserve" a physical processor for running the hypervisor's emulator thread(s). The ``hw:emulator_threads_policy`` extra spec and image property will be **deprecated** in the "S" release for removal in the "T" release. In its place, the following extra specs / image properties will be provided, which are clearer for operators to reason about: * ``hw:overhead_dedicated_set=$CPU_PINNING_STRING`` * ``hw:overhead_shared_set=$CPU_PINNING_STRING`` If the ``hw:overhead_dedicated_set`` extra spec is found, nova will determine the physical processors to use as the dedicated CPUs for the emulator threads by examining the new ``CONF.cpu_dedicated_set`` option. Likewise, when ``hw:overhead_shared_set`` is found, nova will consult the ``CONF.cpu_shared_set`` option to determine which physical processors to assign to an emulator thread. Example flavor configurations ----------------------------- 1) A flavor that wants to consume 4 dedicated CPU resources for the guest to use and 1 shared CPU resource for the hypervisor's emulator thread. The flavor extra specs would look like this: * ``resources:PCPU=4`` * ``resources:VCPU=1`` * ``hw:overhead_shared_set=0`` The above would indicate to the virt driver to assign use the first guest CPU (0th) for an emulator thread. The virt driver would assign one of the physical processors in the ``CONF.cpu_shared_set`` to the first guest CPU. The guest CPUs 1-4 would be dedicated CPU resources and would be assigned four of the physical processors in the ``CONF.cpu_dedicated_set``. 2) A flavor wants to consume 4 shared CPU resources for the guest to use and 1 shared CPU resource for the hypervisor's emulator thread. The flavor extra specs would look like this: * ``resources:VCPU=5`` * ``hw:overhead_shared_set=0`` The above would indicate to the virt driver to assign use the first guest CPU (0th) for an emulator thread. The virt driver would assign one of the physical processors in the ``CONF.cpu_shared_set`` to the first guest CPU. The guest CPUs 1-4 would be shared CPU resources and would be assigned four of the physical processors in the ``CONF.cpu_shared_set``. 3) A flavor wants to consume 4 shared CPU resources for the guest to use and 2 dedicated CPU resource for the hypervisor's emulator thread. The flavor extra specs would look like this: * ``resources:PCPU=2`` * ``resources:VCPU=4`` * ``hw:overhead_dedicated_set=1,2`` The above would indicate to the virt driver to assign the second and third guest CPU for emulator threads. The virt driver would assign two of the physical processors in the ``CONF.cpu_dedicated_set`` to the this guest CPU for running the emulator thread on a dedicated processor. The guest CPUs 0, 3, 4, and 5 would be shared CPU resources and would be assigned four of the physical processors in the ``CONF.cpu_shared_set``. 4) A flavor wants to consume 4 dedicated CPU resources for the guest to use and 1 dedicated CPU resource for the hypervisor's emulator thread. The flavor extra specs would look like this: * ``resources:PCPU=5`` * ``hw:overhead_dedicated_set=1`` The above would indicate to the virt driver to assign use the second guest CPU for an emulator thread. The virt driver would assign one of the physical processors in the ``CONF.cpu_dedicated_set`` to the this guest CPU for running the emulator thread on a dedicated processor. The guest CPUs 0, 2, 3, and 4 would be dedicated CPU resources and would be assigned four of the physical processors in the ``CONF.cpu_dedicated_set``. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- The ``ImageMeta`` object would need to be updated to deprecate some of the properties (e.g. ``hw_cpu_allocation_policy``) and add others. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- This proposal should actually make the CPU resource tracking easier to reason about and understand for end users by making the inventory of both shared and dedicated CPU resources consistent. Performance Impact ------------------ There should be a positive impact on performance due to the placement service being able to perform a good portion of the work that the NUMATopologyFilter currently does. The NUMATopologyFilter would be trimmed down to only handling questions about whether a particular thread allocation policy (tolerance of hyperthreads) could be met by a compute node. The number of ``HostInfo`` objects passed to the NUMATopologyFilter will have already been reduced to only those hosts which have the required number of dedicated and shared CPU resources. Other deployer impact --------------------- Primarily, the impact on deployers will be documentation-related. Good documentation needs to be provided that, like the above example flavor configurations, shows operators what resources extra specs to configure in order to get a particular behavior and which configuration options have changed. Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- Need to think through this well. There are quite a few existing CONF options and extra specs that control pinning behavior. While this proposal reduces this list and makes them consistent, we still need to keep code around nova/virt/hardware.py to handle old options and extra specs. A first step in handling this will be to refactor any code in nova/virt/hardware.py that references hard-coded extra specs or CONF options and turn those references into parameters to functions. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignees: sahid ferdjaoui tetsuro nakamura jaypipes cfriesen stephenfin Work Items ---------- TODO Dependencies ============ The ``update_provider_tree`` blueprint is required for tracking CPU resources when NUMA affinity constraints are required, since the virt driver will be reporting ``VCPU`` and ``PCPU`` inventory records against the child providers representing each NUMA node. Testing ======= TODO Documentation Impact ==================== * Docs for dev-ref * Docs for admin guide about configuring flavors for dedicated and shared CPU resources * Docs for user guide explaining difference between shared and dedicated CPU resources References ========== * `Support shared and dedicated VMs on same host`_ * `Support shared/dedicated vCPU in one instance`_ * `Emulator threads policy`_ * `NUMA topology with resource providers`_ .. _Support shared and dedicated VMS on same host: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543805/ .. _Support shared/dedicated vCPU in one instance: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545734/ .. _Emulator threads policy: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/511188/ .. _NUMA topology with resource providers: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552924/

commit_message:
Use Undercloud local_ip to ensure the registry does answer or not

The Container registry vhost should listen on the Undercloud local_ip
instead of the loopback address.

This patch gets the local_ip of the Undercloud from the undercloud.conf
file to verify if the image-serve service is working and answering.

Change-Id: I8c49001acdf33192d93113e5721f6e9b1aca73f1
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

here, make them synced as we are switching to use
this repo. Package list is sorted.

commit_message:
Support exposing ports in capsule - API

In capsule controller, process the 'ports' field and
convert it to 'exposed_ports' property of the container.
Right now, we process the 'containerPort' and 'protocol' field.
Under the hook, Zun will create a security group for opening
that port and protocol. The 'hostPort' field is ignored since
Zun doesn't expose compute host information. This might be revisited
later and implemented by the neutron floating IP port forwarding
feature.

Change-Id: Ic71d19c5e61573373babb5082331b98847a3cebf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/80/657280/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support exposing ports in capsule - driver

This is a driver side implementation of port mapping for capsule.
Process the exposed_ports on creating each container in capsule.

Change-Id: I901352aa39d40fafe039c96ece4ea45c92f3ffe8

commit_message:
Stop failing on missing memory or CPU

They have been optional for scheduling since Pike and are not used
by Nova at all since Stein.

Change-Id: Idd4d727d3bbcbb8898a0d989d3c496070bc41d8a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/24/665324/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | No longer fails introspection if memory or CPU information is not provided in the inventory. These are no longer required for scheduling, introspection should not require them either.

commit_message:
Switch functional jobs to python 3

As tracked in [0], functional job is the last one not running on
python 3 yet. With new zuul v3 job definition in parent, switch default
and create a tox target for python 2.7

[0] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron_stadium_python3_status

Change-Id: Ifb3b4e1bb7b20c77727d3371bc058ff2cff0c945

commit_message:
Switch functional job to Zuulv3 syntax

This patch switches from legacy networking-sfc-functional-dsvm job to a
Zuul v3 job inheriting from neutron-functional job definition.

Also cleaning up relevant files for legacy job

Change-Id: Ibe8254166cea4000d859f67c1e93eb6c5a743ec1

subject: NumaTopolgyFilter dosen't work as expected as pci_numa_policy is 'legacy'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-12 09:31:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/pci/stats.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/79b94406c5983b742868962ff33e75ff33c42310', 'message': "NumaTopolgyFilter dosen't work as expected as pci_numa_policy is 'legacy'

In NumaTopologyFilter, we set 'pci_numa_policy=legacy' and 'hw:numa_nodes=1'
in flavor, it will causes vm build failed when cpu located in numa1 and pci
located in numa0 in compute node. In pci numa affinity policies, 'required'
means allocated pci devices must be distributed at same numa node, 'legacy'
means allocated pci devices should be distributed at same numa nodes if
available, and 'preferred' is do not provider anything with stricter
affinity to allocate pci devices. But it dosen't work as definition in
practice.
I found a logic error in filter pools for numa cells, 'legacy' will use
filter pools but dosen't care numa has available pci devices which is same
numa with cpu.

Closes-Bug: #1832452

Change-Id: I4efb69490e3338f02cc81e21e557f2cedd7315c0
"}]
commit_message:
NumaTopolgyFilter dosen't work as expected as pci_numa_policy is 'legacy'

In NumaTopologyFilter, we set 'pci_numa_policy=legacy' and 'hw:numa_nodes=1'
in flavor, it will causes vm build failed when cpu located in numa1 and pci
located in numa0 in compute node. In pci numa affinity policies, 'required'
means allocated pci devices must be distributed at same numa node, 'legacy'
means allocated pci devices should be distributed at same numa nodes if
available, and 'preferred' is do not provider anything with stricter
affinity to allocate pci devices. But it dosen't work as definition in
practice.
I found a logic error in filter pools for numa cells, 'legacy' will use
filter pools but dosen't care numa has available pci devices which is same
numa with cpu.

Closes-Bug: #1832452

Change-Id: I4efb69490e3338f02cc81e21e557f2cedd7315c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/664838/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
apt: converge upload + apt_key tasks

This patch uses a feature of apt_key that allows us to send
a payload containing the key data directly without having
to upload it beforehand.

Change-Id: I4d0ce755461ae27018015dd63581ba9b64cf5122

In Python 2, dict.keys() would return a copy of the keys as a

Change-Id: I0c955337b689ad2cbdb3975ca4f1ddd52e277a70
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dictionary changed size during iteration error with Python 3

In Python 2, dict.keys() would return a copy of the keys as a
list which could be modified. In Python 3 it is returned as an
iterator which can't be modified, so simply cast it as a list.

Change-Id: I0c955337b689ad2cbdb3975ca4f1ddd52e277a70

commit_message:
set ignore_basepython_conflict = True in tox.ini

os-vif sets the base python version globally in the
base testenv and relies on tox to pick up the
correct python version form the env name for standard
envs like py27.

This behavior only work reliably if
ignore_basepython_conflict = True is set.

Change-Id: I458cf6cf88d9ee672d6cce59e1d86ed888957042
Closes-Bug: #1832652
(cherry picked from commit e0712563c14755b734f9e109b1b864b45e6c6514)

commit_message:
Set default tempest_install_method for meta handlers

For non-integrated tests tempest_install_method is not defined,
so when python_venv_build tries to launch meta handler, it fails with
undefined variable. Once default is set, this will prevent problems

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665396/

Change-Id: I3cdfe48cae28969dea381bfa325c4bb4769fb4d1

commit_message:
Update qemu hook to facilitate Multicast

mdns AND IPv6 Neighbour Discovery Protocol use multicast packets
and the macvtap interface drops these packets by default.

Since there is no way to tell libvirt to make this better,
lets at least use the hook to make the macvtap interface
change such that multicast packets will pass.

With this, iPXE should work... and mdns should be testable in CI.

Change-Id: I397d211675fd7668b8fd19e989d740d6bad2c70e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/21/665221/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import subprocess if action == "started": interfaces = subprocess.check_output("ip link show type macvtap", shell=True).split("\n") for iface_line in interfaces: if 'macvtap' in iface_line: iface_string = iface_line.split('@') ifaces = iface_string[0].split(' ') ip_cmd = ("ip link set dev %s multicast on " "allmulticast on") % ifaces[1] subprocess.call(ip_cmd, shell=True)

commit_message:
Improve yaml output of "openstack overcloud node provision"

The non-default flow style is better at spreading the yaml over
multiple lines, which is better for readability.

Change-Id: Ibb0c6fb927eca279724cd18e4f8fc9669c02e957
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/40/665040/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: yaml.safe_dump(output['environment'], fp, default_flow_style=False) print('Nodes deployed successfully, add %s to your deployment ' 'environment' % parsed_args.output)
deleted_lines: yaml.safe_dump(output['environment'], fp) print('Nodes deployed successfully, add %s to your deployment' % parsed_args.output)

commit_message:
yum: drop packaging workaround

The workaround for the missing unit file is no longer necessary
as the fix has been merged upstream.  This patch removes that
extra change.

Change-Id: I95c72e9ccb2a96f1956b0b4b8d82ec8d80b29fa9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/53/664653/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # NOTE(hwoarang) on RedHat, rabbitmq-server depends on epmd.service which # depends on epmd.socket which runs on localhost. It is just easier to let # the rabbitmq-server launch epmd directly since we are inside a container. - name: Add rabbitmq-server systemd service (RedHat) template: src: "rabbitmq-server.service.j2" dest: "/etc/systemd/system/rabbitmq-server.service" register: rabbitmq_server_service_added # NOTE(hwoarang) Normally, this task should only be executed when # rabbitmq_install_method == 'distro'. However, the upstream package # does not contain a systemd file and as such we need to provide one. # This should be reverted once https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server-release/pull/31 # is merged and new builds of rabbitmq-server are available. tags: - rabbitmq-config - name: Reload the systemd daemon systemd: daemon_reload: yes when: - rabbitmq_server_service_added is changed tags: - rabbitmq-config

commit_message:
Add section to matrix for Train driver removal

I am going to be removing drivers that have not met
3rd Party Testing requirements from Train. To make
things easier I am adding the section for documenting
these drivers to the support matrix in this patch.

Change-Id: I80c2fcd22b27cf19edc306ea2d9c4dc543418f39

commit_message:
Fix allocate_and_associate DB deadlock

In testing we saw a DB deadlock in allocate_and_associate.
This patch corrects that with a DB retry wrapper.

Change-Id: I20572505e448f9b7ff6314b5167cc4c519c445fb
Story: 2005893
Task: 33751
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/33/665433/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix issues with Percona in Zuul and clean up a little bit

Percona site has connectivity issues from OVH hosts (of Zuul).
This patch makes it so that:
  - the internal repo is actually used
  - RPM GPG keys are downloaded from the actually used repo
  - Ubuntu mimics the RHEL behavior (i.e. the Percona repo is
    enabled only in the xtrabackup image)
    extra benefit: no need for APT preferences for Percona repo
    to spare MariaDB deps

Change-Id: Id27831f6b404762f9e44fd6bd1c4702bf06b05f8
Signed-off-by: RadosÅ‚aw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit de58339a0e1704ae1ade4e032a73bb4708ecfaf1)

subject: Reset MAC on unbinding direct-physical port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-06 06:46:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/95679f79031d5ed892d81a5af1ddd22f5c6a2d2c', 'message': 'Reset MAC on unbinding direct-physical port

direct-physical ports inherit MAC address of physical device
when binding happens (VM created). When VM is deleted this
MAC has to be cleared so other ports may be bound to same device
without conflicts.

commit_message:
Reset MAC on unbinding direct-physical port

direct-physical ports inherit MAC address of physical device
when binding happens (VM created). When VM is deleted this
MAC has to be cleared so other ports may be bound to same device
without conflicts.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py

Change-Id: I9dc8562546e9a7365d18492678f7fc1cb3553622
Closes-Bug: #1830383
(cherry picked from commit e603d19939c98b94081bb6a3af8bcb943f7bd2ce)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/17/663517/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _reset_mac_for_direct_physical(self, orig_port, port, binding): # when unbinding direct-physical port we need to free # physical device MAC address so that other ports may reuse it if (binding.vnic_type == portbindings.VNIC_DIRECT_PHYSICAL and port.get('device_id') == '' and port.get('device_owner') == '' and orig_port['device_id'] != ''): port['mac_address'] = self._generate_macs()[0] return True else: return False mac_address_updated |= self._reset_mac_for_direct_physical( port_db, attrs, binding)

commit_message:
Configure coordination in default for cinder when redis is enabled

Coordination is required for active-active cinder volume.

Change-Id: I9b26831fd951a24c483840a55824fae06ccbbf81
Closes-Bug: #1796615
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/11/608511/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if enable_redis | bool %} [coordination] backend_url = redis://{% for host in groups['redis'] %}{% if host == groups['redis'][0] %}admin:{{ redis_master_password }}@{{ hostvars[host]['ansible_' + hostvars[host]['api_interface']]['ipv4']['address'] }}:{{ redis_sentinel_port }}?sentinel=kolla{% else %}&sentinel_fallback={{ hostvars[host]['ansible_' + hostvars[host]['api_interface']]['ipv4']['address'] }}:{{ redis_sentinel_port }}{% endif %}{% endfor %}&socket_timeout=60&retry_on_timeout=yes {% endif %}

commit_message:
Fix octavia-tempest-plugin releasenotes theme

The octavia tempest plugin release notes were still configured to
use the old oslosphinx theme.
This patch updates the release notes to use the openstackdocstheme.

This patch also enables the release notes to be built and published.

Change-Id: I7877854a86d4cf86614ec281b4840cef50abd4f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin refs/changes/85/649185/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not take ovs from git

We no longer use OVS new features, and the minimal version we require is 2.9.1.
Also, on ubuntu, the version that is supplied by apt is 2.9.2, so it
should be sufficient, and we can save hassle and time by NOT recompiling
the ovs ourselves...

Change-Id: I453dc1d38395015c2d24477b592d1a2ec212e43c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/37/665537/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add octavia-v2-dsvm-scenario-ubuntu-xenial job

This patch adds a xenial scenario job to test xenial controller host
with a xenial amphora image.
This is intended for testing the stable branches.

Change-Id: Iba83543ac92db547fb276947039b00722cf1acee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin refs/changes/83/652683/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add iptables-based active/standby scenario test

This patch adds a tempest scenario test for active/standby topology.

This scenario takes a similar approach to scenario proposed in Change-Id
Ibcd5552a67cea650edc72bfaa986357267ca2407 with the difference that it
does not rely on amphora stats API. Instead, it uses iptables to log VIP
traffic and make assertions based on logging.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I24a6fc3387166ec6cdbd57a5ca9f63743748ec68
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin refs/changes/73/637073/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - job: name: octavia-v2-act-stdby-dsvm-scenario parent: octavia-dsvm-live-base vars: devstack_local_conf: post-config: $OCTAVIA_CONF: api_settings: api_v1_enabled: False controller_worker: loadbalancer_topology: ACTIVE_STANDBY task_flow: engine: parallel tempest_concurrency: 2 tempest_test_regex: ^octavia_tempest_plugin.tests.act_stdby_scenario.v2 tox_envlist: all - job: name: octavia-v2-act-stdby-dsvm-py2-scenario parent: octavia-v2-act-stdby-dsvm-scenario vars: devstack_localrc: USE_PYTHON3: False

commit_message:
Add pkg names better management between OS releases

The check-latest-minor-version role checks if the latest minor version
of python-tripleoclient rpm is installed on the Undercloud. But now, the
package is called python2-tripleoclient on RHEL/CentOS 7 and
python3-tripleoclient on RHEL 8 and it should be the same on the future
CentOS 8.

This patch fixes the naming issue across the supported OS.

Change-Id: If4aeeca507abc1aee3e783a25fb325e53152753e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make "Check if firewalld is installed" task quieter

Stop showing the task has having made changes and silence warning about
not using the yum module (which we could use for the check, but not as
easily).

commit_message:
Debian/Ubuntu: allow to use unsigned repositories

When we run Debian 'buster' or Ubuntu 18.04 in CI job they refuse to
work as infra mirror is not signed.

This patch instructs APT to use unsigned repos anyway.

Change-Id: I530fde5b57894afda2de98d7c217e735497e3feb
(cherry picked from commit 5859180c2c78c62defca37446722b5f15fdbefb7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/99/665199/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(hrw): Debian 'buster' and Ubuntu 18.04 refuse to use unsigned repos RUN echo 'APT::Get::AllowUnauthenticated "true";' > /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/99allow-unauthenticated \ && echo 'Acquire::AllowInsecureRepositories "true";' > /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/99allow-insecure-repos RUN sed -i -e "s|http://archive.ubuntu.com|http://{{ nodepool_mirror_host }}|" \ -e "s|http://ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com/ubuntu|http://{{ nodepool_mirror_host }}/ubuntu-cloud-archive|" \ /etc/apt/sources.list \ && apt-get update
deleted_lines: RUN echo 'APT::Get::AllowUnauthenticated "true";' > /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/99allow-unauthenticated# FIXME(jeffrey4l): seems we can not use unsigned repo in ubuntu 18.04 #RUN sed -i -e "s|http://archive.ubuntu.com|http://{{ nodepool_mirror_host }}|" \ # -e "s|http://ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com/ubuntu|http://{{ nodepool_mirror_host }}/ubuntu-cloud-archive|" \ # /etc/apt/sources.list \ # && apt-get update

commit_message:
use object standardattributes from neutron-lib

This patch switches over to use the standardattributes module from
neutron-lib's object extensions by removing the module and its tests
from neutron and using it from lib instead.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Icbcd17315f9a36b676f730b14fa2bac99c7d00b7

commit_message:
Add a PartitionTableNode to graph

Currently we don't have any synchronisation point for the partition
creation.  This means we have the "have I been called" workarounds in
the Partitioning object as a result of each PartitionNode calling into
it (see I35c5a473509f17a70270a2cbf5bf579faaeb123a for where this went
wrong).

This inserts a single PartitionTableNode at the root of all
PartitionNode objects in the graph.  We create the partition table and
attach/detach the partitions within this node.  PartitionNode thus
just becomes a place-holder for dependencies (i.e. the
create/umount/cleanup commands are blank).

Change-Id: I1b2af14791c5f6f65e52d05fb2724970cf75fb15

commit_message:
Fix listing with --all error

When executing command "karbor xxx-list --all", it will raise
error as 'error: ambiguous option: --all could match --all-tenants,
--all_tenants'. The reason is we have both '--all-tenants' and
'--all_tenants' in the specify operations, '--all' matches two
args, so it can not work, but when using '--all-' or '--all_',
it return the correct result. We should fix it, so we remove the
arg '--all_tenants' which is not in the help info.
Story: 2005874
Task: 33686

Change-Id: Iafa70c35594af732435122ebd50c114fd7f0b9df

commit_message:
Template show in cli should be by default in yaml

Templates are written as yaml so why not show them
in the cli by default as yaml. User can still see it
in json using the flag -f json

Change-Id: I17c5b26b8ef2a0ae02886dbf703c29434ad89781

subject: Fix race condition when caching in debootstap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-07 06:15:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/fd5731341842a2539677619f3bdf7dac457e8340', 'message': 'Fix race condition when caching in debootstap

Currently there is the race condition in the debootstrap element:
when multiple DIBs are running in parallel they might want to write to
the same tar-file.
This patch fixes the problem: it creates first a temporary file
and then moves the result in an atomic operation to the final
destination.

Change-Id: I51a200151f5a6e404cb9f2cc151418c2e6f0dd85
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-15 05:00:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/94baeb79bd007b8dd8c5fe2b533c43f587b18495', 'message': 'Fix race condition when caching in debootstap

This patch fixes the problem: it creates first a temporary file
and then moves the result in an atomic operation to the final
destination.

commit_message:
Fix race condition when caching in debootstap

Currently there is the race condition in the debootstrap element:
when multiple DIBs are running in parallel they might want to write to
the same tar-file.
This patch fixes the problem: it creates first a temporary file
and then moves the result in an atomic operation to the final
destination.

Change-Id: I51a200151f5a6e404cb9f2cc151418c2e6f0dd85
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/23/454523/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "Caching debootstrap result in ${TARGET_ROOT}/${DEBOOTSTRAP_TARBALL}" # There is a need to use a temporary file for the cache: # When two or more DIBs are running in parallel, writing # to the same file is a race-condition. # The following lines implement a simple 'the last one wins' strategy. TEMP_DEBOOTSTRAP_FILE=$(mktemp --tmpdir ${TARGET_ROOT} debootstrap-XXXXXXX) trap "rm -f ${TEMP_DEBOOTSTRAP_FILE}" EXIT sudo tar --numeric-owner -C ${TARGET_ROOT} -zcf ${TEMP_DEBOOTSTRAP_FILE} --exclude='./tmp/*' . mv ${TARGET_ROOT}/${TEMP_DEBOOTSTRAP_FILE} ${TARGET_ROOT}/${DEBOOTSTRAP_TARBALL} trap - EXIT
deleted_lines: echo Caching debootstrap result in $DEBOOTSTRAP_TARBALL sudo tar --numeric-owner -C $TARGET_ROOT -zcf $DEBOOTSTRAP_TARBALL --exclude='./tmp/*' .

commit_message:
Summarize output of sample configuration generator

Our sample configuration files are long. Really, really long. Make them
shorter through use of the summarize option added to oslo.config years
ago [1]. This turns a help text like the following:

  [DEFAULT]

  # This option helps you specify initial virtual disk to physical disk
  # allocation ratio.
  #
  # This is only used when initially creating the ``computes_nodes``
  # table record for a given nova-compute service.
  #
  # See https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/configuration/schedulers.html
  # for more details and usage scenarios.
  #
  # Related options:
  #
  # * ``disk_allocation_ratio``
  #  (floating point value)
  #  Minimum value: 0
  initial_disk_allocation_ratio = 1.0

Into:

  [DEFAULT]

  # This option helps you specify initial virtual disk to physical disk
  # allocation ratio. For more information, refer to the documentation.
  # (floating point value)
  # Minimum value: 0
  initial_disk_allocation_ratio = 1.0

Shorter, one line descriptions are kept as-is.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/commit/2f8025b22

Change-Id: Iaa51b6a139fc9b7ffc97cd6881a9d49b29858b9b

commit_message:
Take pf index instead of phys_port name in representors renaming script

In rhel-7.7 kernel the uplink representor doesn't have value
for phys_port_name so the matching will always fail.
So modifying the script to compare with pf index instead

Change-Id: I67d51a52d70369fbafdc59dd6936c0ae4ed6224d
Closes-Bug: #1830716
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config refs/changes/21/661721/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pf_index_num=`expr match "$PORT" 'pf\(.*\)vf.*'` for i in `ls -1 /sys/class/net/*/device/uevent` nic_pci=$(grep PCI_SLOT_NAME /sys/class/net/$nic/device/uevent | cut -d'=' -f2) nic_fun_num=`expr match "$nic_pci" '.*\([0-7]\)'` if [ "$pf_index_num" = "$nic_fun_num" ] &&
deleted_lines: parent_phys_port_name=${PORT%vf*} parent_phys_port_name=${parent_phys_port_name//f} for i in `ls -1 /sys/class/net/*/phys_port_name` phys_port_name=`cat /sys/class/net/$nic/phys_port_name 2>/dev/null` if [ "$parent_phys_port_name" = "$phys_port_name" ] && exit

commit_message:
Fix /etc/hosts

Without this fix, Ubuntu provisioned images have quite
big delays when trying to connect to them using SSH
(and therefore Ansible) due to a missing or improper
/etc/hosts contents.

The fix is forging/updating a suitable default /etc/hosts
file according to other existing informations in the current
image (like /etc/hostname) and produces similar /etc/hosts
contents to what is effectively done in a standard Ubuntu
installation.

Change-Id: Idb9a90ebaea78fe5d5772186a5effffbb2704277
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/40/581240/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Copyright 2018, OpenNext SAS # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # dib-lint: disable=set setu setpipefail indent if [ ${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-0} -gt 0 ]; then set -x fi set -e # This will create proper /etc/hosts file if [ -f /etc/hosts ]; then mv /etc/hosts /etc/hosts.ORIG fi if [ ! -f /etc/hostname ]; then if [ -n "$DISTRIB_ID" ] && [ "$DISTRIB_ID" == "Ubuntu" ]; then echo -e '127.0.1.1\tubuntu' >>/etc/hosts fi else hosts=$(cat /etc/hostname) short_hostname=$(cat /etc/hostname | awk -F. '{print $1}') if [ "$hosts" != "$short_hostname" ]; then hosts="$hosts $short_hostname" fi echo -e "127.0.1.1\t$hosts" >>/etc/hosts fi echo -e '127.0.0.1\tlocalhost' >>/etc/hosts

commit_message:
Add uuid for vfat

As described in the comments, the vfat index is overloaded by Linux
systems to a uuid suitable for use in fstab.  Add uuid generation to
vfat.

Change-Id: I293738b86b153926d8db51e69c3e8fe9361ed91f

added_lines: _DIB_PY_REWRITE=${_DIB_PY_REWRITE:-}if [ -z "$_DIB_PY_REWRITE" ]; then # Check for required tools early on for X in ${!IMAGE_TYPES[@]}; do dib-preflight-check ${IMAGE_TYPES[$X]} done
deleted_lines: # Check for required tools early on for X in ${!IMAGE_TYPES[@]}; do case "${IMAGE_TYPES[$X]}" in qcow2) if ! type qemu-img > /dev/null 2>&1; then echo "qcow2 output format specified but qemu-img executable not found." exit 1 fi ;; tgz) # Force tar to be created. IMAGE_TYPES+=('tar') ;; vhd) if ! type vhd-util > /dev/null 2>&1; then echo "vhd output format specified but no vhd-util executable found." exit 1 fi ;; squashfs) if ! type mksquashfs > /dev/null 2>&1; then echo "squashfs output format specified but no mksquashfs executable found." exit 1 fi ;; docker) if ! type docker > /dev/null 2>&1; then echo "docker output format specified but no docker executable found." exit 1 fi if [ -z "$DOCKER_TARGET" ]; then echo "Please set --docker-target." exit 1 fi ;; esac done # NOTE: fstrim is on most all recent systems. It is provided by the util-linux # package. if ! type fstrim > /dev/null 2>&1; then echo "fstrim utility is not found. This is provided by util-linux package" echo "Please check your PATH variable is set correctly" exit 1

commit_message:
Use ansible for ArtifactsConfig

Replace the Heat SoftwareDeployment with an ansible task for running the
deploy-artifacts.sh script.

Change-Id: Ib5f114440fcfcb7a7652111f0651ef01761d2601
implements: blueprint reduce-deployment-resources

added_lines: DeployArtifactURLs: default: [] description: A list of HTTP URLs containing deployment artifacts. Currently supports tarballs and RPM packages. type: comma_delimited_list deploy_artifact_urls: {list_join: [' ', {get_param: DeployArtifactURLs}]} deploy-artifacts.sh : {get_file: ../puppet/deploy-artifacts.sh} - name: ArtifactsConfig script: deploy-artifacts.sh environment: artifact_urls: {{ '"{{' }} deploy_artifact_urls {{ '}}"' }}
deleted_lines: # Artifacts config is done on all roles, not only # enabled_roles, because on upgrade we need to write the json files # for the operator driven upgrade scripts (the ansible steps consume them) {% for role in roles %} # Prepare host tasks for {{role.name}} {{role.name}}ArtifactsConfig: type: ../puppet/deploy-artifacts.yaml {{role.name}}ArtifactsDeploy: type: OS::Heat::StructuredDeploymentGroup condition: {{role.name}}NonZero properties: name: {{role.name}}ArtifactsDeploy servers: {get_param: [servers, {{role.name}}]} config: {get_resource: {{role.name}}ArtifactsConfig} {% endfor %}

commit_message:
Use ansible for NetworkConfig

Use ansible to apply the NetworkConfig resource instead of the
NetworkDeployment resource. The script module is used to run the same
rendered script as NetworkDeployment. In the future the script could be
refactored into a more proper ansible role, but the first step is to
remove the SoftwareDeployment for NetworkConfig and just use an ansible
task.

Change-Id: Ie60ddb90562f9630c24711337473f9e3acdcf4c1
Depends-On: Ie543782569de14d56bc41740611f7512e8357a22
implements: blueprint reduce-deployment-resources

added_lines: NetworkDeploymentActionsValue: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: value: - if: - role_network_deployment_actions_exists - {get_param: {{role.name}}NetworkDeploymentActions} - {get_param: NetworkDeploymentActions} neutron_physical_bridge_name: {get_param: NeutronPhysicalBridge} neutron_public_interface_name: {get_param: NeutronPublicInterface} network_deployment_actions: {get_attr: [NetworkDeploymentActionsValue, value]}

commit_message:
Add panko_api_cron container

Currently panko expirer isn't running in a separate container,
which results in events piling up in the configured database.
This change deploys panko_api_cron as a container and
periodically deletes events from db

Closes-Bug: #1832274
Change-Id: I4c941048a3561af9458208fe86e1b86156eb7ebc
(cherry picked from commit 66a638a8df8fa5b7c9bb92eb1e9da9d09c1fb447)
